Hello <@U03REFNRMB3> Yes, I also fixed same.
Thank you so much for your quick reply!
I was expecting that this parameter default fetch from API but got it that it can available when fetchbyID.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/api/settings/users/user-details#retrieve-users>

not the companytoContacts.  You can retrieve this value via the API but if you just want the number to enter it on your code, then you can do this:

Go to Settings -> Custom Objects (Choose the Teams if you have more custom objects) -> Associations -> Teams to Contacts -> click edit on the association you want to set via your code, then on the URL   you pick the number next to edit-association-label as shown on the screenshot.
Getting 404 in this API
Are you sure that user number is good?  404 means it couldn't find the user.
Yes because I searched same using different way and got the id so Id exist but it returns 404.
hmmm, I wonder if this is something to look at:
I am using this api to fetch all the users from HubSpot account and it will return all basic detail of users like firstname,lastname,email etc

I know - but that is the User Provisioning API I referenced above (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/api|API Guides>SettingsUsersSettings API | User Provisioning).  This id value may not be the same id value in the Users API which is a different API (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/api|API Guides>SettingsUsersAccount | Users API) - I think that is what the notification message is saying - the id values are not the same in those different APIs - let's try this - go to the Users and Teams and find that user and see if the id displayed is the same or different:
I solved it, anyone who have the same need just contact me
Also, I like to check the older developer docs sometimes because they are different:    <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/users>

Hi All,

Does anyone know why we don't get "total" key in /crm/v4/objects/{objectType}/{objectId}/associations/{toObjectType} api?
This returns "paging" key but not "total". How does this work with a pagination?
yes but in that api there is no parameters for firstname, lastname or email
I am sorry for so much questions but I spent 5 hours into same and then I asked here. And I really appreciate your quick reply and Thank you for same.

you can add any additional fields you want back by adding the properties parameter with a list of properties you want to receive back.  By default all the APIs only return a small list of standard properties. - And you're entirely welcome, I only wish to help if I can

I researched for the same. There are no properties for these details like firstname,lastname,email.
And no reference between these 2 apis so that developer can map both like the one which return all the other details than the name |email and the one which returns name and email

Is there any HubSpot core developers here, who can provide any solution and help us to understand from where we can get all the details of users ?
Any help would be appreciated! Because there should be some way to fetch all details from one api otherwise the apis are not ready to use. Sorry but I am sharing my experience as from so many hours searching on same but did not get anything from which can get users name,emial,created-date,updated-date etc..

Hi All, I am very new to Hub Spot,  and trying to generate the API key for using the Hub spot APis. I ma unable to locate it in the settings options as mentioned din the documentation. CAn anyone help please.

You can generate a key via <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/apps/public-apps/overview|public app (w/ ><https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/apps/public-apps/overview|oauth)> or <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/apps/private-apps/overview#view-private-app-access-token-information|private app>.

Hi, all, need help on contacts patch API call. I'm trying to update a contact, V3 patch API,  for a new contact that I created through post API. I always get 404, resource not found error. Do I miss anything? The patch API endpoint is {{API_URL}}/crm/v3/objects/contacts/45070121761. I set authorization bearer header with value of my private app access token. The id value, 45070121761, comes from POST API response.
